      68             : /**
      69             :  * PluginModuleParent
      70             :  *
      71             :  * This class implements the NPP API from the perspective of the rest
      72             :  * of Gecko, forwarding NPP calls along to the child process that is
      73             :  * actually running the plugin.
      74             :  *
      75             :  * This class /also/ implements a version of the NPN API, because the
      76             :  * child process needs to make these calls back into Gecko proper.
      77             :  * This class is responsible for "actually" making those function calls.
      78             :  *
      79             :  * If a plugin is running, there will always be one PluginModuleParent for it in
      80             :  * the chrome process. In addition, any content process using the plugin will
      81             :  * have its own PluginModuleParent. The subclasses PluginModuleChromeParent and
      82             :  * PluginModuleContentParent implement functionality that is specific to one
      83             :  * case or the other.
      84             :  */

     456             :      * was instantiated by the plugin host.

     463             :     /*
     464             :      * Takes a full multi-process dump including the plugin process and the
     465             :      * content process. If aBrowserDumpId is not empty then the browser dump
     466             :      * associated with it will be paired to the resulting minidump.
     467             :      * Takes ownership of the file associated with aBrowserDumpId.
     468             :      *
     469             :      * @param aContentPid PID of the e10s content process from which a hang was
     470             :      *   reported. May be kInvalidProcessId if not applicable.
     471             :      * @param aBrowserDumpId (optional) previously taken browser dump id. If
     472             :      *   provided TakeFullMinidump will use this dump file instead of
     473             :      *   generating a new one. If not provided a browser dump will be taken at
     474             :      *   the time of this call.
     475             :      * @param aDumpId Returns the ID of the newly generated crash dump. Left
     476             :      *   untouched upon failure.
     477             :      */

     479             :                           const nsAString& aBrowserDumpId,

     481             : 
     482             :     /*
     483             :      * Terminates the plugin process associated with this plugin module. Also
     484             :      * generates appropriate crash reports unless an existing one is provided.
     485             :      * Takes ownership of the file associated with aDumpId on success.
     486             :      *
     487             :      * @param aMsgLoop the main message pump associated with the module
     488             :      *   protocol.
     489             :      * @param aContentPid PID of the e10s content process from which a hang was
     490             :      *   reported. May be kInvalidProcessId if not applicable.
     491             :      * @param aMonitorDescription a string describing the hang monitor that
     492             :      *   is making this call. This string is added to the crash reporter
     493             :      *   annotations for the plugin process.
     494             :      * @param aDumpId (optional) previously taken dump id. If provided
     495             :      *   TerminateChildProcess will use this dump file instead of generating a
     496             :      *   multi-process crash report. If not provided a multi-process dump will
     497             :      *   be taken at the time of this call.
     498             :      */
